intro: Setachna sylvatica, commonly known as the forest setachna, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Setachna sylvatica thrives in moist, shaded woodland environments and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora.
